item.title: How to prepare Green Mango Salad
item.description: Green Mango Salad, also known as Som Tum in Thai cuisine, is a refreshing and tangy dish that combines the tartness of green mangoes with the crunch of vegetables and the kick of spices. It's perfect as a light meal or a side dish. Here’s how to prepare a delicious Green Mango Salad at home: Ingredients: 2 medium green mangoes, peeled and julienned 1 medium carrot, peeled and julienn
item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.title: How to prepare Dal Palak
item.description: Dal Palak is a nutritious and delicious dish made with lentils and spinach. It's a popular Indian recipe that combines the health benefits of dal (lentils) and palak (spinach) into a flavorful and wholesome meal. Here’s how you can prepare Dal Palak at home: Ingredients: For the Dal: 1 cup toor dal (split pigeon peas) or moong dal (split yellow lentils) 4 cups water 1/2 teaspoon tur
item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.title: How to prepare Pani Puri
item.description: Pani Puri is a fun and delicious twist on the classic Indian street food, Pani Puri (or Golgappa). This snack involves small, crispy puris filled with a tangy, spicy, and flavorful water (pani) along with a savory filling. Here's how to prepare Pani Puri: Ingredients: For the Puris: 1 packet of ready-made puris (available at Indian grocery stores) or you can make them at home if you prefe
item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.title: How to prepare Kala Khatta Gola
item.description: Kala Khatta Gola, also known as Kala Khatta Ice Gola or Black Currant Ice Gola, is a popular Indian street treat, especially during the summer. This refreshing dessert is made with crushed ice, flavored syrup, and a blend of tangy and spicy seasonings. Here's how you can prepare Kala Khatta Gola at home: Ingredients: For the Kala Khatta Syrup: 1 cup black currants (or use black currant sy
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: How to prepare Dhokla
item.description: Dhokla is a popular Gujarati snack that is steamed and made from fermented rice and chickpea flour (besan). It's light, spongy, and usually served with green chutney. Here's a detailed recipe to prepare traditional Dhokla at home: Ingredients: For the Dhokla Batter: 1 cup rice 1/2 cup chana dal (split chickpeas) 1/2 cup urad dal (split black gram) 1/2 cup yogurt 1 tablespoon ginger-gr
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: How to prepare Sattu Paratha
item.description: Sattu Paratha is a delicious and nutritious stuffed flatbread popular in the Indian states of Bihar, Jharkhand, and Uttar Pradesh. It is made with sattu (roasted gram flour) and various spices, creating a savory filling wrapped in a whole wheat dough. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: How to prepare Tamarind Rice
item.description: The tamarind rice dish you're referring to sounds like Tamarind Rice, also known as Puliyodarai or Pulihora, which is a popular South Indian dish. Here's a recipe to prepare it: Ingredients: For the Rice: 1 cup rice (preferably sona masoori or any medium-grain rice) 2 cups water A pinch of salt For the Tamarind Paste: 1 lemon-sized ball of tamarind (or 2-3 tablespoons of tamarind
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: How to prepare Mango Coconut Rice
item.description: Mango Coconut Rice is a delicious and fragrant dish made with ripe mangoes, coconut milk, and aromatic spices. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: How to prepare Methi Thepla
item.description: Methi Thepla is a popular Gujarati flatbread made with fresh fenugreek leaves, whole wheat flour, and spices. It's a delicious and nutritious dish that can be enjoyed as a snack or as part of a meal. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: How to prepare Kokum Rasam
item.description: Kokum Rasam is a tangy and flavorful South Indian soup made with kokum extract, tomatoes, spices, and other aromatic ingredients. Here's a simple recipe to prepare Kokum Rasam: Ingredients: 1 tablespoon kokum extract (kokum juice) 2 medium-sized tomatoes, chopped 1 teaspoon cumin seeds 1 teaspoon black peppercorns 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds 1/2 teaspoon fenugreek seeds 1-2 dry red chilies
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: How to prepare Coconut Ladoo?
item.description: Coconut ladoo is a delicious Indian sweet made from grated coconut, condensed milk, and cardamom. Here's a simple recipe to prepare coconut ladoo: Ingredients: 2 cups grated coconut (fresh or desiccated) 1 cup sweetened condensed milk 1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom (optional) 2 tablespoons chopped nuts (such as almonds, cashews, or pistachios) for garnish (optional) Google Ad 1 Instruct
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Different spices are used to make a garam masala mix?
item.description: Garam masala is a quintessential spice blend used in Indian cuisine. It adds warmth, depth, and complexity to dishes, and its composition can vary widely based on regional preferences and personal taste. item.title: Samosas - Snack from the Indian subcontinent
item.description: Samosas are a popular savory snack originating from the Indian subcontinent. They are triangular-shaped pastries filled with a savory mixture of spiced potatoes, peas, and sometimes other ingredients. item.title: How to prepare Pizza at home
item.description: Here's a recipe for homemade pizza: For the Pizza Dough: Ingredients: 2 ½ cups all-purpose flour 2 ¼ teaspoons instant yeast 1 teaspoon sugar 1 teaspoon salt 1 cup warm water 2 tablespoons olive oil Instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, instant yeast, sugar, and salt. item.title: How to prepare Palak Paneer at Home - Palak Paneer Recipe
item.description: Palak paneer is a popular North Indian dish made with spinach and paneer (Indian cheese). Here's a recipe for preparing palak paneer at home for serving four people: Ingredients: 2 cups chopped spinach (palak) 200g paneer, cut into small cubes 1 medium-sized onion, chopped 2 medium-sized tomatoes, chopped 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste 1 green chili, chopped

item.title: How to prepare Mango Pickle at Home - Mango Pickle Recipe
item.description: Mango pickle is a popular Indian condiment made with raw mangoes and spices. Mango pickle is a variety of pickles prepared using mango. It is very popular in South and Southeast Asia. The pickling process in India differs from other regions mainly due to an additional spice mixture added to them after anaerobic fermentation. item.title: Indian style Spanish omelette, Egg + Potato + Onion
item.description: Egg with Potato plus Onion will make a delicious and healthy breakfast, You have have it as a Breakfast or you can have it as a Snack in the day, will also be a great starter in the barbecue. This combination of dish is called Spanish omelette, but lets make it in Indian Style. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Egg Stuffed Paratha Home made Recipe
item.description: Egg Stuffed Paratha is a delicious and healthy Paratha dish, filled with egg mixture. Both the eggs and whole wheat are healthy as it provides the right amount of proteins and carbs. The egg mixture has finely chopped onions, green chili and coriander leaves. This is then slided into the half cooked paratha pockets and cooked further. The Egg Stuffed Parathas are quite filling in itself. Ingredie
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Pudina chutney Recipe - Andhra Style
item.description: Pudina Chutney is a flavorful condiment and aromatic chutney to serve with rice, mudde, idli, dosa. Pudina Chutney can also be served with snacks like bonda, bajji too. People sometimes are confused pudina chutney with mint chutney or green chutney that is served along with chats and tandoori platter, but it's not the same which we serve with rice or mudde or idle, and this chutney is more au
item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.title: Dal Bhat Recipe - Nepali Style
item.description: Dal Bhat or Nepali Dal Bhat, is a dish made of lentils and rice, actually It is considered that this is the national dish of Nepal. Generally the rice is either boiled or steamed and It is served in the middle of the dish and surrounded by the dal or lentils and sometimes with some other curries or chutney or with a pickle. For people, Dal Bhat is easy to cook and it can be cooked with other flav
item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.title: Pachi Chintakaya Pachadi Recipe, Andhra Style
item.description: Andhra Style Pachi chintakaya pachadi (Green raw tamarind pickle) is an age-old dish, which is generally eaten with Rice & some also eaten with Ghee for even better taste. As we Indians love the tangy & sweetish taste of pickle, this delicious Pachi chintakaya pachadi is enjoyed by all age groups and in fact, the recipe is one among the famous Indian dishes. This dish also has many health benefits
item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.title: Pachi Pulusu Recipe - Andhra Style
item.description: Andhra Style Pachi Pulusu Recipe is a thin rasam made with freshly extracted tamarind water and mixed with sliced onions and freshly cut coriander leaves. Comfort food at its best when served with some steamed rice for a simple meal. It is a different way of creating a rasam that has been followed by the people from Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. item.title: Raw Mango Chutney - Andhra Style
item.description: Raw mango chutney is a flavorful condiment made with raw mangos, coriander leaves, onions and some spices. Raw Mango Chutney is a must-try recipe when raw mangoes are in season.
